Good Morning Britain viewers fell in love with a hero dog on the show today - but were quickly distracted by his hunky owner.

Handler Marshall Mirachi appeared on the ITV programme with dog Hurricane, who is receiving the Order of Merit from PDSA Merit Award later today after saving former president Barack Obama from an attacker at the White House.

The former US Secret Service dog is the first international animal to receive the British honour.

Hurricane managed to stop an intruder who scaled a White House fence in October 2014. Despite the intruder punching and kicking him, the dog dragged the man to the ground and allowed the Secret Service agents to intercept.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

And while viewers adored Hurricane, viewers were very much appreciating Marshall too with his shoulder-length inky, wavy hair, beard and tats.

One tweeted: "He’s gorgeous. The dog isn’t bad either #GMB."

While another commented: "Is hurricanes handler single?? @GMB #GMB."

A third remarked: "Got a feeling all the ladies and some gents at #GMB will be taking a particular interesting in #hurricanethedog @GMB #dingdong."

"Hellllooo!!!! #GMB," another wrote.

One commented: "Agent Marshall Mirarchi Ohhh hello #GMB."

Another remarked: "Wow sod the dog just look at the handler #GMB."

"Who is this man adopt me #GMB," a fan gushed.

*Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV
